so new to the forums be gentle.

made a pretty big rover but along the line i got a problem. It stopped wanting to turn right. furthermore sometimes it dont wanna turn left either. forward and backwards works just fine. Is this a known issue or have i done ....ed up somewhere along the build process?

link to craft file:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/7j29qiymp44jqrc/Mega%20Base.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/7j29qiymp44jqrc/Mega%20Base.craft?dl=0)

any help would be nice. especially if it fixes my problem ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Hi Elveswarrior, unless your wheels are breaking off it's probably just the steering method they use, they are meant to be tank-like so instead of tuning one side slows and the other speeds up.

Those wheels don't turn very well when moving quickly, you need to slow down ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Are there reaction wheels on this rover? Is SAS on? Are you driving in docking mode?

Sal "The Ninja" Vager

oh i know the tank drive part which is why i test it out while standing still aswell. it refuses to turn right at any given time. and sometimes start driving backwards instead of turning left when driving left
Can't see the picture. Navball pointing at the sky?
and now the freaking think can turn. having done nothing different merely loading it again to try Pecans point of nav ball turning. I dont get it but hell the thing works now and im happy
So name your rover 'Zoolander' and have done with it...
